posts.post_content: This is quite possibly the single card with the most potential combos. Just look at these comments; they're dripping with auto-card links. I use four of these with [Flickering Ward](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Flickering Ward), [Eight-and-a-Half-Tails](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Eight-and-a-Half-Tails), [Angel's Feather](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Angel's Feather), [Rune of Protection: White](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rune of Protection: White) (usually situational cards popular with newbies getting solid, reliable results!), [Pentarch Paladin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pentarch Paladin) (cheap, repeatable [Vindicate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vindicate)), [Kithkin Rabble](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kithkin Rabble) (gets powered up by lands in addition to permanent spells) and [Iona, Shield of Emeria](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Iona, Shield of Emeria). Even without an ability, it's still a playable creature. 1/3 for 2 is pretty much par for the course.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
[Grindstone](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grindstone), as mentioned before is likely the best card for this, yet there are still a lot of other fun combos with this card.   
It can make many Sideboard-choices to Mainboard-awesomesauce.  
Take [Seedtime](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Seedtime) for inststance. Green [Time Walk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Time Walk) four times in an [Extended](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Extended) or [Legacy](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Legacy) deck? Sounds like fun!

Posted By: Mode (9/7/2009 8:04:56 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Personally, I think mill is rather boring, predictable, and WAY overestimated. There are so many other good uses for this card. It's a shame that this is rotating out of standard, really, but at least it's still in extended and will definitely be in vintage. A couple of good uses for this bad boy:  
  
~Your typical Scarecrow deck for Shadowmoor/Eventide  
~The Invasion cycle of legendary dragons (esp. [Rith, the Awakener](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rith, the Awakener) and [Treva, the Renewer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Treva, the Renewer).)  
~[Vampire Nocturnus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vampire Nocturnus)  
~[Akroma, Angel of Wrath](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Akroma, Angel of Wrath) or [Akroma, Angel of Fury](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Akroma, Angel of Fury), or just about any card with protection from a color (not counting cards like [Progenitus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Progenitus).)  
~Cards that have Radiance (from the Ravnica block)  
~[Deathmark](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Deathmark) or any other cards that destroy or exile cards of a particular color(s).  
  
Those are just a few of the many possibilities you can use this card for. So take the time and explore all of the ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
Personally, I think mill is rather boring, predictable, and WAY overestimated. There are so many other good uses for this card. It's a shame that this is rotating out of standard, really, but at least it's still in extended and will definitely be in vintage. A couple of good uses for this bad boy:

~Your typical Scarecrow deck for Shadowmoor/Eventide
~The Invasion cycle of legendary dragons (esp. Rith, the Awakener and Treva, the Renewer.)
~Vampire Nocturnus
~Akroma, Angel of Wrath or Akroma, Angel of Fury, or just about any card with protection from a color (not counting cards like Progenitus.)
~Cards that have Radiance (from the Ravnica block)
~Deathmark or any other cards that destroy or exile cards of a particular color(s).

Those are just a few of the many possibilities you can use this card for. So take the time and explore all of the ... (see all)
